cpvcode: Test and evaluation of security equipment
timark: Short description of the contract or purchase(s):
txtmark: The National Policing Improvement Agency (NPIA) has a requirement for an independent method for testing service elements of a TErrestrial Trunked RAdio (TETRA) based communications system deployed throughout England, Wales and Scotland. The elements requiring to be tested include functionality, performance and radio coverage. The requirement is for a range of services including equipment supply, data collection, analysis of data collected and reporting of results. Data may only be obtained via TETRA compliant radio terminals approved for connection to the network. Ideally, the data collection system should be able to interface with a number of manufacturers’ TETRA terminals. The requirement is to provide a Framework Arrangement under which the testing requirements can be called off by the NPIA or other emergency services. A valid third party TEA2 licence will be required to operate TETRA terminals on the network, and any award of a Framework Arrangement would be subject to the successful tenderer acquiring such licence and maintaining such licence for the term of the Framework Arrangement. Some of the parameters and data to be logged and extracted include, but not limited to, RSSI, Voice Quality grading, call set up time, data performance including data latency. It is a mandatory requirement that the successful tenderer’s staff directly associated with undertaking the work will have to successfully undergo security clearance under the Government Vetting Scheme to a minimum of SC level and Non-Police Personnel Vetting (NPPV) level prior to their direct involvement in the Framework Arrangement.

cpvcode: Test and evaluation of security equipment

The University of the Arts London seeks competitive offers for the provision of the following listed services relating to various sites that are owned or occupied by the University, its staff or students. Services being tendered for but not restricted to the following: plant preventative maintenance, planned fabric and structures maintenance, routine repair work, emergency repairs and urgent repairs, and minor building and maintenance work. Please note that the service requirement is not restrictive or entirely subjective to the listed CPV codes or descriptions. Reference to the CPV codes should be used as guidance to the type of service(s) requirement by the Organisation. The contract will be for a minimum of 3 years with the option of a further 12 months extension available. Description of the CPV codes are as follows: Preventive maintenance services. Repair and maintenance services of boilers. Repair and maintenance services of cooler groups. Refurbishment work. Repair and maintenance services of electrical and mechanical building installations. Repair and maintenance services of building installations. Boiler installation work. Repair and maintenance services of electrical building installations. Electrical services.

timark: Short description of the contract or purchase(s):
txtmark: The Public Carriage Office (PCO) is part of Transport for London (TfL) and is responsible for the licensing and regulation of taxi and private hire services in London. The PCO also works to make services safer and more accessible and is one of the key stakeholders in the Mayoral Safer Travel at Night (STaN) initiative. As part of the STaN initiative, four late night marshalled taxi rank schemes have been established (Cranbourn Street, Beckenham, Kingston, and Bromley). The schemes are in areas with busy late night economies and the key aims have been to increase the supply of available taxis late at night and provide a safe waiting environment for passengers and drivers. Subject to continued funding, it is the intention that these schemes will now be permanent. As such, in seeking to replace the current individual arrangements, we are now going out to tender for the provision of marshals for the schemes. Whilst the preferred option is for all four schemes to be let to a single supplier, proposals for individual lots will be considered. Dependant upon the continued success of these schemes, additional requirements could result.
UK-London: security services

timark: Short description of the contract or purchase(s):
txtmark: Supply of 2 rigid inflatable boats (RIBs) for use on and around The Thames by Marine Support Unit. The first RIB should be delivered around mid-2008 and the second will be delivered prior to 3/2009 subject to agreement. Depending on funding and operational issues there may be a requirement for a 3rd and 4th vessel prior to 3/2011. It should be noted that slight variations may be required on the 2nd (and 3rd/4th) RIB subject to the performance and operation of the initial vessel(s). The RIBs should be capable of carrying and deploying MPS staff and divers and also conducting boarding operations. RIBs should be longer than 10 m with a GRP hull and have an internal beam not less than 2,1 m. They should carry a maximum of 12 people and be capable of a minimum top speed of 50 knots over a measured mile when fully laden with a complement of 4. Propulsion should be twin inboard diesel engines with sterndrives. A capsize reversal system should be fitted as part of an A frame. The full specification will be provided in the tender package. The resulting contract should be open to other governmental bodies and similar organisations.
UK-London: police patrol boats

timark: Short description of the contract or purchase(s):
txtmark: The contracting authorities are seeking an innovative private sector partner or partners to participate and invest in a new public private partnership vehicle (a "Local Education Partnership" or "LEP") to be established jointly with or open to some or all of the contracting authorities. It is envisaged that the LEP will provide (or arrange for the provision of) and will be held accountable for the "Partnering Services" in the London Borough of Barking & Dagenham (and possibly in the administrative area of the London Borough of Havering and/or the administrative area of Thurrock Council), which may include (but are not limited to) the development of a strategic investment programme for: (a) educational facilities, which will include the construction or refurbishment of secondary schools and other educational sites/facilities (including colleges of further education), and may include/extend to the refurbishment of the existing primary school estate; (b) community services and facilities, which may include housing, leisure and sports facilities, retail, offices, workspaces/workshops and factories as part of a wider regeneration project; and (c) any other facilities to be provided by one or more of the contracting authorities in the exercise of the powers contained in section 2(1) of the Local Government Act 2000, (together the "Relevant Facilities") in the contracting authorities' area. It is envisaged that these Partnering Services will also comprise of the following services: (a) strategy advisory services; (b) programme management services; (c) project development services; (d) procurement consultancy services; and (e) procurement and delivery or management of all services required to deliver the strategic investment programme for the Relevant Facilities (including through the provision, integration and management of supply chain arrangements). It is anticipated that such services may include: (i) architectural services; (ii) engineering services; (iii) construction services; (iv) technical services; (v) building services; (vi) hard facilities management services; (vii) soft facilities management services; (viii) educational support services; (ix) education programme development services; (x) educational strategy services; (xi) housing services; (xii) leisure and sport services; (xiii) apprenticeships; (xiv) retail and/or office management services; and (xv) services relating to the provision of factories and workshops, for a period of up to 15 years. The Relevant Facilities, which may be a mixture of new build and refurbished facilities, will be delivered under the Private Finance Initiative ("PFI") and/or design and build arrangements. This may include the delivery of the Relevant Facilities through separate Special Purpose Vehicles ("SPV") established by the LEP. Where an SPV is established, the shareholders in such SPV may include the LEP, third party equity providers and supply chain members. The contracting authorities may contract directly with the LEP or, where an SPV is established, with the SPV. The LEP may also be required to provide acceptable transitional arrangements in relation to contracts awarded under this tender, for example where the contracting authorities' existing arrangements are not uniform in their expiry or transfer. The LEP may also be required by the London Borough of Havering to deliver its BSF Programme in the administrative area of the London Borough of Havering. This may be delivered by a mixture of new build and refurbishment under the Private Finance Initiative (PFI) and/or design and build arrangements. The London Borough of Havering BSF Programme may be delivered by the LEP through Special Purposes Vehicles (“SPV”) established by the LEP. Where an SPV is established the shareholders in such SPV may include the LEP, third party equity providers and supply chain members. The London Borough of Havering may contract directly with the LEP or where an SPV is established with the SPV. The LEP may also be required by Thurrock Council to deliver its BSF Programme in the administrative area of Thurrock. This may be delivered by a mixture of new build and refurbishment under the Private Finance Initiative (PFI) and/or design and build arrangements. Thurrock Council's BSF Programme may be delivered by the LEP through Special Purposes Vehicles (“SPV”) established by the LEP. Where an SPV is established the shareholders in such SPV may include the LEP, third party equity providers and supply chain members. Thurrock Council may contract directly with the LEP or where an SPV is established with the SPV. The LEP may also be required by Barking College to deliver works and/or services at Barking College. The contracting authorities have issued a separate contract notice for an Information and Communications Technology (“ICT”) managed services provider to provide ICT services, ICT assets and ICT infrastructure in secondary schools. The provision of ICT services, ICT assets and ICT infrastructure may be extended to primary schools, and other corporate local authority services in the London Borough of Barking & Dagenham. The London Borough of Havering and/or Thurrock Council may also exercise their option to employ the services of the ICT managed services provider. The LEP and the ICT managed services provider will be required to work together to deliver the London Borough of Barking & Dagenham's BSF Programme. Further details are contained in the memorandum of information and pre-qualification questionnaire (see section Vl.3 for details of how to obtain these).
UK-Barking: business and management consultancy and related services

timark: Short description of the contract or purchase(s):
txtmark: Provide 24 hour, 7 days a week, 365 days per year call-off arrangements (including but not necessarily limited to): high pressure welding of valves and pipework - provide labour, materials and expertise to work on existing valves and pipework from 10 mm diameter to 254 mm diameter, operating at temperatures up to 540 degree C and pressure up to 168 bar, the removal from line, weld prepping and reinstatement, potentially to include unit outage requirements; industrial cleaning- provide equipment, materials and labour for heavy industrial plant cleaning. Internal cleaning of boilers, turbines, auxiliary plant and general station areas, potentially to include unit outage requirements; office cleaning - provide equipment, material and labour for the cleaning of offices, meeting rooms, canteen and control rooms within a power station; security guarding - provide labour for the provision of security services including personnel and vehicular access, monitoring and examination of the site perimeter security equipment and security within the site.
